creator_2: Benedict Pierre Goerges Hochreutiner  G. Long
physical_appearance: This is a French-Dutch-Malay dictionary. It is worn along its edges, and has some scribbling along the top right corner. The spine appears to be weak and tattered.
sgcool_label_text: This pocket-sized French-Dutch-Malay dictionary, published in Java in 1906, is extremely rare, being the first and only edition. It was compiled by G. Long and Bénédict Pierre Georges Hochreutiner, respectively assistant and temporary assistant at the Botanic Gardens of Buitenzorg (Bogor), in the Dutch East Indies. The fact that botany officers were involved in the production of this tri-language dictionary underscores the importance that European technocrats placed on learning Malay so that they could operate in the field
title_text: Pocket sized French-Dutch-Malay Dictionary LONG, G. and HOCHREUTINER, Bénédict Pierre Georges.  Petit dictionnaire Français-Hollandais-Malais dans l'ordre alphabétique des trois langues... Kleine alfabetische woordenlijst in het Fransch-Hollandsch-Maleisch... Kitab lograt dari bahasa Melajoe, Wolanda dan Prantjis.  Batavia, Kolff & Co, 1906.
creator_role: compilers (people in literature) compilers (people in literature) publishers
subject_terms_2: Dictionary  Malay language  French  Dutch  Dutch East Indies  s Lands Plantentuin (this is oddly, the name of Botanic Gardens of Buitenzorg)  Java (Indonesia)
